Gift to Kim Jong Il from U.S. religious leader
    Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from U.S. religious leader Rev. William Franklin Graham, the third.
 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by Dr. Melvin Ree Cheatham, personal representative of Rev. Graham, on a visit to the DPRK.

Release of workers demanded
    Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions reportedly released a statement on June 18 denouncing the Seoul high court for demanding five years in prison against Tan Pyong Ho, chairman of the confederation, at a trial on appeal.
 The statement said that this prosecution lays bare the authorities' position to escalate the suppression and block the advance of workers.    
 The confederation would wage an all-out struggle for the release of the chairman and other detained workers and an end to the "corrupt regime," the "regime cracking down upon the labor movement.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian dance troupe
    Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Russian Moiseyev State Academy Folk Dance Troupe.
 The gift was handed to secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Jong Ha Chol by director of the visiting troupe Yelena Shervakova who is heading the troupe.

articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian figure
     Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Igor Moiseyev, founder of the Russian Moiseyev State Academy Folk Dance Troupe.
 The gift was handed to Jong Ha Chol, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by Yelena Shervakova, director of the troupe on a visit to the DPRK.
